comments:
1. Launch a program in debug mode.
2. Hit a breakpoint
3. Evaluated "0x80000000". No result are return and the log contains the
following trace :

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 1 4 May 31, 2002 16:55:56.229
!MESSAGE Unhandled exception caught in event loop.

!MESSAGE For input string: "80000000"

        at

        at java.lang.Integer.valueOf(Integer.java:505)

        at org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.ReturnStatement.accept0(ReturnStatement.java:73)

        at org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.ASTNode.acceptChild(ASTNode.java:1377)

org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.MethodDeclaration.accept0(MethodDeclaration.java:180)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.ASTNode.accept(ASTNode.java:1330)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.ASTNode.acceptChildren(ASTNode.java:1400)
        at
org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.TypeDeclaration.accept0(TypeDeclaration.java:160)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.ASTNode.accept(ASTNode.java:1330)

The problem is tools from the standart Java API doesn't managed such numbers, we
need to find a way to parse these numbers and get their values (may be copy a
piece of code for the compiler).

The same probleme appears when we try to evaluate "-2147483648" (-2^31) and
"-9223372036854775808L" (-2^63)

A workaround is to used the equivalent signed number, i.e. :

-0x7ffffffe instaed of 0x80000001
-0x00000001 instaed of 0xffffffff
...

This workaround doesn't work for the most negative literal of type int or long
(i.e. : 0x80000000, -2147483648, -9223372036854775808L, ...)

Fixed in ASTInstructionCompiler.

Also, added tests to the eval test suite.
